statement.tex: %text For what value of $n$ are the $n^{th}$ terms of the following two arithmetic progressions equal? $A=\{63,65,67,...\}$ and $B=\{3,10,17,...\}$ %
\\ A=\{63,65,67,...\} \\ B=\{3,10,17,...\} \\ %text What is the general form for the $n^{th}$ terms of the above series? %
\\ a_n=63+(n-1)2,\, b_n=3+(n-1)7 \\ %text If $a_n=b_n$, what is the value of $n$? %

reason.tex: %text The generic $n^{th}$ term $a_n$ of an AP is given by $a_n=a+(n-1)d$, where $a$ is the first term and $d$ is the common difference between terms. Judging by the terms for given series, % \begin{align} &a_1=63, d_a=(65-63)=2 \\ \implies &a_n = 63+(n-1)2 \\ &b_1=3, d_b=(10-3)=7 \\ \implies & b_n=3+(n-1)7 \end{align}
